title: Failure to recover after network outtage: ProtoArray: Best node is not viable for head
body:
Version: `teku/v21.3.2/linux-x86_64/-privatebuild-openjdk64bitservervm-java-13`

I had a 2 hour internet outage. After the network recovered, Teku regained peers but was unable to import blocks or produce attestations. This lasted 4 hours until I restarted Teku, which successfully restored normal functioning.

This is the network going down:

```
23:10:03.157 INFO  - ^[[37mSlot Event  *** Slot: 924948, Block: a630f3..d23a, Epoch: 28904, Finalized checkpoint: 28902, Finalized root: 802403..11fa, Peers: 100^[[0m
23:10:15.160 INFO  - ^[[37mSlot Event  *** Slot: 924949, Block: 6780ce..77eb, Epoch: 28904, Finalized checkpoint: 28902, Finalized root: 802403..11fa, Peers: 100^[[0m
23:10:23.358 INFO  - ^[[34mValidator   *** Published attestation  Count: 1, Slot: 924950, Root: 10ba31..4275^[[0m
23:10:27.159 INFO  - ^[[37mSlot Event  *** Slot: 924950, Block: 10ba31..4275, Epoch: 28904, Finalized checkpoint: 28902, Finalized root: 802403..11fa, Peers: 100^[[0m
23:10:31.005 INFO  - ^[[34mValidator   *** Published aggregate    Count: 1, Slot: 924950, Root: 10ba31..4275^[[0m
23:10:39.159 INFO  - ^[[37mSlot Event  *** Slot: 924951, Block: 5eaa67..05eb, Epoch: 28904, Finalized checkpoint: 28902, Finalized root: 802403..11fa, Peers: 100^[[0m
23:10:51.159 INFO  - ^[[37mSlot Event  *** Slot: 924952, Block:    ... empty, Epoch: 28904, Finalized checkpoint: 28902, Finalized root: 802403..11fa, Peers: 100^[[0m
23:11:03.183 INFO  - ^[[37mSlot Event  *** Slot: 924953, Block:    ... empty, Epoch: 28904, Finalized checkpoint: 28902, Finalized root: 802403..11fa, Peers: 100^[[0m
23:11:15.154 INFO  - ^[[37mSlot Event  *** Slot: 924954, Block:    ... empty, Epoch: 28904, Finalized checkpoint: 28902, Finalized root: 802403..11fa, Peers: 94^[[0m
23:11:27.154 INFO  - ^[[37mSlot Event  *** Slot: 924955, Block:    ... empty, Epoch: 28904, Finalized checkpoint: 28902, Finalized root: 802403..11fa, Peers: 0^[[0m
23:11:39.154 INFO  - ^[[37mSlot Event  *** Slot: 924956, Block:    ... empty, Epoch: 28904, Finalized checkpoint: 28902, Finalized root: 802403..11fa, Peers: 0^[[0m
23:11:51.154 INFO  - ^[[37mSlot Event  *** Slot: 924957, Block:    ... empty, Epoch: 28904, Finalized checkpoint: 28902, Finalized root: 802403..11fa, Peers: 0^[[0m
23:12:03.153 INFO  - ^[[37mSlot Event  *** Slot: 924958, Block:    ... empty, Epoch: 28904, Finalized checkpoint: 28902, Finalized root: 802403..11fa, Peers: 0^[[0m
```

This is the network coming back:

```

01:07:14.718 ERROR - Internal error while importing block: a63c2c..2352 (925458)
java.util.concurrent.CompletionException: java.lang.RuntimeException: ProtoArray: Best node is not viable for head
        at java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture.encodeRelay(CompletableFuture.java:367) ~[?:?]
        at java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture.completeRelay(CompletableFuture.java:376) ~[?:?]
        at java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture$UniRelay.tryFire(CompletableFuture.java:1093) ~[?:?]
        at java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture.postComplete(CompletableFuture.java:506) ~[?:?]
        at java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture.completeExceptionally(CompletableFuture.java:2159) ~[?:?]
        at tech.pegasys.teku.infrastructure.async.SafeFuture.lambda$propagateResult$3(SafeFuture.java:142) ~[teku-infrastructure-async-21.3.2.jar:21.3.2]
        at java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture.uniWhenComplete(CompletableFuture.java:859) ~[?:?]

01:07:14.972 INFO  - Chain reorg at slot 925533 from a63c2c..2352 to 9486d5..c6b4. Common ancestor at slot 925458
01:07:15.771 INFO  - Chain reorg at slot 925533 from 9486d5..c6b4 to 58fbc7..d8bb. Common ancestor at slot 925459
```

After many more reorgs and one more instance of the same exception, no blocks are imported and attestation production sometimes, but not always, fails with a slashing protection exception.  The main point is that all slots are shown as empty until the restart.

```
01:38:15.154 INFO  - ^[[37mSlot Event  *** Slot: 925689, Block:    ... empty, Epoch: 28927, Finalized checkpoint: 28923, Finalized root: 9fea93..6ca1, Peers: 100^[[0m
01:38:27.156 INFO  - ^[[37mSlot Event  *** Slot: 925690, Block:    ... empty, Epoch: 28927, Finalized checkpoint: 28923, Finalized root: 9fea93..6ca1, Peers: 100^[[0m
01:38:39.156 INFO  - ^[[37mSlot Event  *** Slot: 925691, Block:    ... empty, Epoch: 28927, Finalized checkpoint: 28923, Finalized root: 9fea93..6ca1, Peers: 99^[[0m
01:38:51.156 INFO  - ^[[37mSlot Event  *** Slot: 925692, Block:    ... empty, Epoch: 28927, Finalized checkpoint: 28923, Finalized root: 9fea93..6ca1, Peers: 99^[[0m
01:38:51.216 ERROR - Refusing to sign attestation:  source epoch (28924) is safe, target epoch (28927) is unsafe.  Previously signed source epoch 28922, target epoch 28927
01:38:51.220 ERROR - ^[[31mValidator   *** Failed to produce attestation  Slot: 925692 Validator: 0x<redacted>^[[0m
tech.pegasys.teku.core.signatures.SlashableConditionException: Refusing to sign attestation at slot 925692 with source epoch 28924 and target epoch 28927 because it may violate a slashing condition
```

I can provide the full log file if useful.
Can confirm that this is a duplicate of #3793 which we've fixed with #3797.
